meanings.definition: Release or remove a clamp or clamps from (something)
meanings.sent1: I will start unclamping the pipes to fix the leak.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic unclamped the engine to access the faulty part.
meanings.sent3: As the magician waved his wand, the handcuffs unclamped themselves!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter unclamped the tension in the room like a gentle breeze.
meanings.sent5: The sun's warmth unclamped the frozen ground, allowing the flowers to bloom.

meanings.definition: Free from a clamp or clamps
meanings.sent1: The unclamping process made the machine easier to move.
meanings.sent2: After the unclamping procedure, the object was finally free.
meanings.sent3: The unclamping tool had a quirky design that made it stand out.
meanings.sent4: The unclamping sensation was like a weight being lifted off.
meanings.sent5: The unclamping action revealed the true beauty of the sculpture.
